Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2007 12:03PM beedee wrote: Sounds crazy, doesn't it, almost unbelievable. That is the shortest wait in my province. I am in eastern Canada.
Posts.Title: Frustrated and Discouraged... beedee leaf

Posts.Content: beedee wrote: I decided to start a new thread, my old one ("what could this be?") was getting too long. Two weeks ago, I saw the surgeon, to see if he knew what was going on. He didn't really know from what I could figuire, and thought I should see a dermatologist. He was supposed to contact my dr. and my dr. would find a dermatologist. My family dr's office has still not gotten anything from the surgeon. My family has given this much less attention than the surgeon, he never even examined hardly it at all, and has been very rushy with me lately. I have fears that I have IBC right now, and I'm extremely worried. I've cried so much lately. I have decided that tomorrow, I will go see my family dr, and ask for a dermatologist appt, not that I think that is the problem, but I am hoping that a dermatologist will do a biopsy. I'm yet to find something like what I have, besides IBC, and neither dr has given an opinion on what it could be, and they seem puzzled. I'm so scared. This is so hard to handle, at 19 I feel that this is a lot to deal with. I have so much fear. This is MY health, and I feel that the healthcare system is failing me, there should never be this much waiting, not with an issue like this. Have any of you dealt with drs like this and how did you handle it? I am going to try to get an dermatologist appt tomorrow when I see my dr. I'm sorry for venting, I'm worried sick, and I feel so alone... Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2007 10:32AM beedee wrote: There are actually derms in my province who are booked for the next 9 months! ITS RIDICULOUS! The derm that i am supposed to see is a 3hr drive away!
Posts.Title: Frustrated and Discouraged... beedee leaf

Posts.Content: beedee wrote: I don't know if you all remember me or not, but I have an update! I seen a dermatologist, and he thinks I have Morphea. I dont know much about it, it could very well be the cause of the thickening of my skin and the large bump above my breast. If any of you know anything about this, any info would be appreciated. The derm also did two biopsies to eliminate cancer as a possibility and put my mind at rest. Apparently there is a cancer which mimics morphea, and he wants to make sure it isnt that. He really thinks it is morphea though. So I'm just waiting for results. He put me on a strong steroid ointment and I will probably have to use a cream for the rest of my life. But it is much better than cancer and I am thankful to finally have some possible answers. Hopefully the biopsy results come back fine. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: update beedee beedee
